definition: on one's deathbed/at the point of death
full/to fill/completely/more
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
border/edge/boundary/interval/between/inter-/to meet/time/occasion/to meet with (circumstances)

sentences.english: The wise old Mother Superior was dying.
sentences.chinese: 睿智的老女修道院長處在了彌留之際。

sentences.english: Near death, the farmer called his clever son to his side.
sentences.chinese: 彌留之際，農夫叫聰明的老大到他的身邊。

sentences.english: However plum one day a thin continue, and finally to happen.
sentences.chinese: 但是梅子一天天瘦了下去，終於到了彌留之際。

sentences.english: So, painstakingly, he combed the thatch of the past.
sentences.chinese: 在彌留之際，他艱難地梳理密密麻麻的往事。

sentences.english: In his last time Hassan let Nassau lead the whole caravan.
sentences.chinese: 彌留之際，老人把整個商隊的命運和未來交給了兒子。

sentences.english: In the moribund patient deepening coma are the usual preludes to death.
sentences.chinese: 病人彌留之際，加深的昏睡通常是死的前兆。

sentences.english: Live as you will have wished to have lived when you are dying.
sentences.chinese: 要過上你彌留之際所希望的生活。

definition: to leave office
Chiang Wei-kuo (1916-1997), adopted son of Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
seriously ill and about to die
to die in battle (idiom)
to hang oneself
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
hearse
to keep watch beside a coffin
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
overjoyed at unexpected good news (idiom)
beautiful women suffer unhappy fates (idiom)
